sections.title: Eminent Personalities of India
sections.subtitle: Leaders who shaped the foundation of the nation

items.name: Dr. B. R. Ambedkar
items.description: Principal architect of India’s Constitution and a lifelong champion of equality, education, and social justice.

items.name: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose
items.role: Leader of the Indian National Army
items.description: A fearless nationalist who organized the Indian National Army and gave a new direction to India’s freedom struggle.

items.name: Shaheed Bhagat Singh
items.description: A symbol of courage and sacrifice whose ideals inspired generations of Indians to fight for freedom.

items.name: Mahatma Gandhi
items.description: Leader of India’s independence movement who led the nation through the principles of truth and non-violence.

items.name: Shivaram Rajguru
items.description: A revolutionary patriot remembered for his decisive role in the struggle against British rule.

sections.title: Sacrifices of Saints — Eminent Souls of India
sections.subtitle: Spiritual courage that protected humanity and faith

items.name: Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji
items.description: Remembered for his supreme sacrifice in defense of religious freedom, human dignity, and righteousness.
